content.label: I was a fan of a couple of the music artists already so that brought me to the game initially.  It‚Äôs remained one of favorite mobile games of all time.  Still haven‚Äôt beat all the arcade levels tho... gets very difficult!

I really enjoy the game concept, graphics, and LOVE the music. Unfortunately for me, it‚Äôs still stressful. I was hoping to find a game to help with that as this has done for many others so I‚Äôve read.

So a few weeks ago I remembered this game from when I was younger and I couldn‚Äôt remember the name and just today I found it and I was like ‚ÄúOH MY GOD I NEED TO DOWNLOAD THIS‚Äù and this game is very nostalgic to me so I have really enjoyed it so all 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

title.label: Asks to much $ for what used to be included for free

content.label:
Music you now have to buy. 

Why sell a game promoting the music and then have the customer buy the music if they want to listen to feature that‚Äôs advertised in the game.
Pleasant and challenging

title.label: A favorite - Both relaxing and challenging

content.label:
A great game that provides relaxing, ambient escape, while also giving a challenge to complete each level. Amazing game dynamic of propelling yourself by squirting away some of your mass, while needing to get big by absorbing smaller creatures and not getting absorbed yourself.

I really wish they would create an expansion.
Great to pass the time in mellow serenity
I‚Äôve been playing this game since the IPod generation and I have a iPhone and I love it that it‚Äôs here
Hope to see a graphics update sometime. Perfect otherwise.

I love this game. This is my go-to game these days. It‚Äôs beautiful. I think the music can be good, but I love the game without it too. Need something to wind down with before bed? Slow down time (you can do that with this game) and just let the current and the pretty lights take you. 

I do like some levels a LOT more than others. The ‚ÄòSentient‚Äô levels are by my favorite. I‚Äôve played them all 1000x by now, and they don‚Äôt really get old for me. I almost wish they‚Äôd beef this game out with an expansion. I‚Äôd definitely pay money, especially for more Sentient-like levels.
Challenging, atmospheric, visually pleasing. What more do you want from a 99 cent game? Buy this wonderful game and if nothing else, leave it on for the atmosphere it creates. Love it

title.label: Awesome game-been playing it for years

content.label: Hey guys, this game is incredible. I‚Äôve been waiting for Osmos 2 forever now. Honestly, if you were about to release Osmos 5 and we‚Äôre charging $5 for each version I would be saying ‚Äútake my money - PLEASE!‚Äù  What are you waiting for???
I enjoy that each game only takes a few minutes and some levels are quite challenging.
I played this game years ago and then lost my phone. I could never remember the name of it. I just found it again and I couldn‚Äôt be happier!
I‚Äôve spent way too many hours playing this game. It‚Äôs really good.
Title says all. It‚Äôs perfect for it‚Äôs price
This game provides no clue how it is supposed to work. Absurd. Run away from this turkey.
I wish they would make more levels or challenges. I have gifted the app to several people, so we are all addicted to playing. Please update with more levels or challenges.
It‚Äôs a whole new experience, and this has been a favorite since I was little!

Osmos was one of the first must play iOS/Mobile games, and still is. It is a brilliantly relaxing game, with a superb soundtrack. It just exudes tranquility‚Äîwill bring your stress level down by at least 66%.

super chill game. i bought this years ago and bought it again when i got a new phone. never had a single crash, lag or any other issue. honestly i read some other recent reviews about being stuck on levels.. some of them are difficult, but none are impossible. this isn‚Äôt a game to fly through every level on the first, or even third try sometimes. it is challenging but not challenging enough to make you feel defeated. well worth the small price they charge for the chill soundtrack and great graphics. not many games can still look and run seamlessly years later but this game stands the time. my only note is that i would love to see some new levels added! well done devs. keep it up!

I wish this were a more likable game. It pulls you in with its mesmerizing audio and video elements, the purely physical logic of control and gameplay... at first blush, seemingly close to perfection as a game.  Then, it takes you from those soaring heights to the bottomless pit of despair when there is a difficult level to pass.  The problem is, there‚Äôs no randomness worked into it.  On some of the free-floating levels, if you start out with a slightly smaller bubble just out of reach, to reach which you need to expend an amount of yourself that will result in your no longer being larger, that‚Äôs it.  You‚Äôre screwed.  The level will never begin even slightly differently.  You have one chance.  My blood pressure, after trying this level over and over again for ten minutes, is too high to continue.  For my own safety, I am deleting the app.  I like the game enough to watch for future improvements.  But for now, it‚Äôs not worth playing.

title.label: This game was amazing years ago.

content.label:
I remember beating this game when it first came out. 
Now, I absolutely hate this game. 
Idk if they updated it or what, but I don‚Äôt remember having to choose between being right zoomed up on the orb, or sacrificing the quality and fine detail to see the bigger picture. 
I remember being able to scale and kind of pick where your zoom could go to an extent. None of that. You‚Äôre either tightly zoomed, or if zoomed out a bit not focused on where you need to be, cannot scale the screen and see what you need to see you‚Äôre fully zoomed out. 

Completely bogus. 

I used to play this game right before going to sleep because it was so relaxing. 
I decided tonight to play again, and- yeah. No enjoyable at all just because of the zooming experience. 

What‚Äôs the point of the zoom in/out if I can‚Äôt fully see what I need to avoid because I‚Äôm zoomed too close or I can‚Äôt see where I‚Äôm going because I‚Äôm zoomed too far?!

title.label: Incorrectly Posted to App Store for iPad

content.label: DO NOT BUY THIS VERSION IF YOU WANT IT ON YOUR iPAD!!  I typed in Osmo in the search, tapped the one that came up and bought it.  Opened it and then find out it‚Äôs specifically for the iPhone.  What a fantastic FAIL by this company.  I guess I should‚Äôve read the description closely, but they didn‚Äôt need to list it as being compatible with iPad if they are selling an iPad only version.  I didn‚Äôt buy this app to have to play it in expanded mode.  I don‚Äôt relish the idea of giving this company more money to be able to get the version I originally wanted to purchase.
Well designed challenges are rendered beautifully.  One of the rare games I play w sound

title.label: Amazingly soothing. Ephemeral from start to finish.

content.label: I absolutely recommend this app!!

Osmos is a pretty fun game. But I really think the fourth level (or maybe it was the fifth) is really tricky. I would originally give this app 3 stars but it deserves an extra star because this game shows absolutely no ads, which I find very helpful! Please listen to my review, I think it‚Äôs very reasonable.
Played it on PC years ago.  A lot has been added, including multiplayer player (?!).  Awesome chill game, perfectly priced.  Hats off to the devs!

title.label: Always come back to playing Osmos!

content.label: I started playing this entrancing game a few years ago, and I always come back to it! Would love a sequel in the future!
This app is fun and calming and challenging everything you'd hope to expect of a mobile game.
This game transcends.

title.label: I see motes when I close my eyes from playing so much.

content.label: Requesting new levels
This is an awesome game. Subtle, careful movement is often required, and each level is constantly suspenseful. The beautiful design and ambient music help make the experience thoroughly absorbing.
The game is basically a cooler looking version of ogario , but Ogario has better controls . Please make the controls better.

title.label: I bought the iPhone app in addition to the iPad App...

content.label:
That had to tell you something... I liked the game so much on the iPad, and played it for years. Then when I found it was available on the iPhone X I just had to get that version. 

The best way to support game development is to buy the good apps!

Well done. Still love it. 

PS: excellent game for headphones and commutes in the morning.
Simply the best game ever published on an iphone.
Years later, this is still a great game. Happy to see the iPhone X update.

I really love this game. I've had it for 24 hours and have played it for 16 of those hours. If I didn't have to sleep I would have played it for 24 hours! Realistic physics interaction. There are no flaws. Beautiful trance-like music. Gorgeous graphics. I need 100 more games just like this one. There are about 30 levels and none of them are frustratingly hard. About 5 levels are kind of challenging. And EVERY level is a joy. Bravo to the developer.
Fun and relaxing. If you are looking for a great game to play when your baked. This is it. And use headphones !!

This may be a great game but it totally messes up all of the settings in my phone. I deleted it hoping the changes would go away as I couldn‚Äôt close the little monster. A screen outline started showing up on other sites I was using. Maybe it was due to my later modeled iPhone but I am still trying to go in and retrieve my original settings. So far this is the most intrusive game I have hardly played.
I am colorblind and couldn't play after level 4, where you need to distinguish between red and green.

title.label: Buying for iPhone doesn‚Äôt get you iPad app

content.label: I bought this thing on my iphone, planning to play it on my iPad, and it does not allow you to get the iPad version after paying for the app. You can only play the mobile-optimized version.
Developer responded to my review. The iPhone X update has me in tears. Simply great.

My brother and I would play Osmos on the way back and forth on long journeys, but the Bluetooth multiplayer feature (a long time ago) was removed. Now we can no longer play since we do not have access to a wifi network when traveling.
You will enjoy it Immensely..!!
One of the best games for the iPhone since the beginning. I scrolled down to the bottom of the list of purchases and was pleased to find this gem. It needs to be on the front page again üå∂üåä
A well-made game. You would be hard-pressed to find any fault with it. This was one of the first iOS games I played years ago; it‚Äôs still one of the best iOS games out there!
This game is a classic. It doesn‚Äôt even deserve to be called a game by how relaxing it is. You reaaaally need to play this with headphones on.
I love this game it's so much fun and relaxing
